intro: Gussonia australis, commonly known as the New Zealand bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in damp, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms during the spring and summer months. Gussonia australis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitats.
